result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:21 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Ryan R Galganski in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Ryan R Galganski. Atty. Nimmer provides an update; the ADA assigned just responded to her counter-offer and her client would like to have plea and sentencing before Branch 2.  Atty. Nimmer is asking for a new plea and sentencing date.  State has no objection.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing before Branch 2.  Atty. Nimmer is also asking that the defendant remain in the Waukesha County Jail pending sentencing.  State has no objection.  Court will order that the defendant remain in the custody of the Waukesha County Jail pending the next court date or until further order of the Court.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 28, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

11:09 AM Defendant Ryan R Galganski in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Ryan R Galganski. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.
Case called for status. 
Blood results have not been received yet.
Defense has just received an offer, but has not had time to review with defendant. 
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Defense requests that Defendant remain at Waukesha County Jail through plea and sentencing.
Court grants and orders Defendant to remain at Waukesha County Jail through plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.   **Rescheduled due to conflict with the Court's calendar.**
Hearing on August 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:25 AM Defendant Ryan R Galganski in court, in custody, with SPD Intern, Erik Schlueter for attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  
Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM durationpursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.   Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

01:15 PM Defendant Ryan R Galganski in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
